title-group.article-title: Resistance to the Message: James Merrill's Occult Epic

James Merrill, two typed pages dated 25 April 1973. This transcript served as back- ground to "The Will" (Selected Poems 271). 271

Adrienne Rich, for instance, turned to increasingly innovative forms and imagery in the 1960s, beginning with Snapshots of a Daughter-in-Law (1963)
Rich
Snapshots of a Daughter-in-Law 1963

Auden's speech is found in an entry for 31 May 1977 in a spiral notebook dated 1977: "OUR WALLS HAVE DROPPED AWAY WE WERE AFRAID O THANK GOD YOU HAVE COME WE THOUGHT WE HAD LOST TOUCH WE STRAINED TO HEAR." The corresponding passage in Scripts for the Pageant reads as follows: "OUR WALLS HAVE LONG SINCE DROPPED AWAY O THANK / GOD U HAVE COME WE THOUGHT WE HAD LOST TOUCH / MAY WE ASK QUESTIONS? HUSH WE STRAIN TO HEAR" (359).

Der Doppelgänger and doubling in Merrill's poem
Merrill
Der Doppelgänger
Elaine Pagels has observed that some Gnostic literature presents the serpent as the principle of divine wisdom, and the expulsion as a beneficial stage in human develop- ment (xvii; 30-31). 30

Peter Middleton has written regarding Blake, "The recurrence of names is not a guarantee of an existing entity, successfully named and located, able to unify the appearances of its names in the text. Instead this recurrence marks redefinition, re-examination, as of the terms used in a long, complex process of rea- soning. ... These characters are not, we might say, quite in the same play or on the same stage or even quite all there" (41) 41
